byline.contributor: Iraqi employees of The New York Times contributed reporting from Salahuddin, Anbar and Kirkuk Provinces.

abstract: Iraqi army forces carry out strike against Islamic State outside city of Ramadi; attack is viewed by some local officials as beginning of offensive against militant group in its stronghold in Anbar province, though others say it is too soon to tell.
lead_paragraph: Some local officials said it was the beginning of a major offensive in western Anbar Province, though others said such a description was premature.

headline.main: Iraq Starts Drive Against ISIS, but Reports on Scale Differ
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Officials Deny Attack on ISIS Signals the Start of a Key Battle

snippet: Some local officials said it was the beginning of a major offensive in western Anbar Province, though others said such a description was premature.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
